posts.post_content:
Goofy as it seems nay sayers, Bladewing the risen and rorix bladewing can exsist in play at the same time, yes we know in our hearts its the same dragon but the rules say he has two different names.
  
Same for Jeska, warrior adept and Phage the untouchable. Same person, different name.

Posted By: XTwistedsoulX (5/19/2010 1:13:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is a risen [Bladewing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=205371), so this makes him a Zombie i guess.  
But according to Kev Walker's artwork, this actually looks pretty much like a *Zombie Dragon **Skeleton*** to me.  
  
I wouldn't say he's a must-have in a Dragon tribal deck. But he's definitely worth using.  
When put onto the battlefield with [Dragon Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Storm) (although this card would normally not be used in a common tribal deck for that matter), his trigger effect will also always come handy.  
If you're splasing white, when combined with a cycled [Eternal Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Dragon) you can ensure that his cip/etb effect will have use.  
Or if you reanimate a [Broodmate Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Broodmate Dragon), you can pump three 4/4 flying fatties with his ability next turn for a devasting attack.  
As opposed to other dragons you might be able to make more use of [his thrall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=47224) since they share the same creature type. Although as aforement... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This is a risen Bladewing, so this makes him a Zombie i guess.
But according to Kev Walker's artwork, this actually looks pretty much like a Zombie Dragon Skeleton to me.

I wouldn't say he's a must-have in a Dragon tribal deck. But he's definitely worth using.
When put onto the battlefield with Dragon Storm (although this card would normally not be used in a common tribal deck for that matter), his trigger effect will also always come handy.
If you're splasing white, when combined with a cycled Eternal Dragon you can ensure that his cip/etb effect will have use.
Or if you reanimate a Broodmate Dragon, you can pump three 4/4 flying fatties with his ability next turn for a devasting attack.
As opposed to other dragons you might be able to make more use of his thrall since they share the same creature type. Although as aforement... (see all)

posts.post_content: He ironically combos well with himself. Cast his living version on turn 6 and attack, trade with something huge, then cast his dead version on the next turn and bring his living version back to attack again. The logic is so flawed that it's actually kind of funny.

posts.post_content:
@ EricB - Definitely looks better in the new foil version imo. But then a lot of Kev Walker's cards do. He does a lot of misty backgrounds which have amazing depth on foil prints but look a bit flat on the normal cards.  
As for the card himself, he's pretty cool. He definitely makes for some memorable moments in dragon theme decks. Especially when he returns himself, in the form of [Rorix Bladewing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rorix Bladewing)! There's something strangely cool about the idea of a one-person tag team!
posts.html:
@ EricB - Definitely looks better in the new foil version imo. But then a lot of Kev Walker's cards do. He does a lot of misty backgrounds which have amazing depth on foil prints but look a bit flat on the normal cards.
As for the card himself, he's pretty cool. He definitely makes for some memorable moments in dragon theme decks. Especially when he returns himself, in the form of Rorix Bladewing! There's something strangely cool about the idea of a one-person tag team!

posts.post_content: @exodus: you win. also, write to Kev Walker and see if you can get them to actually use that flavor text on a new version of this guy in FTV: Legends. bet you anything we'll see one or two of the FTV: Dragons get their long-overdue MYTHIC rating. not more than 2, certainly, bec that would detract more than add to the set, but I could see Bladewing the Risen and Nicol Bolas being in it. Or at least I can hope. I know, Nicol has had SO MANY printings, considering he's a freaking Elder Dragon, but come on-- it just seems 'NOT FAIR' that FTV: Dragons came out RIGHT. BEFORE. posts.post_content:
Perfect for my Dragon Reanimator deck.
  
Turn 1: Swamp -> [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) -> [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive) Bladewing, [Bogardan Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bogardan Hellkite), [Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund)   
Turn 2: Swamp -> [Reanimate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reanimate) Bladewing -> Bogardan Hellkite -> Reanimate Karrthus -> Attack -> Win
  
I love my Reanimator Deck.
posts.html:
Perfect for my Dragon Reanimator deck.
Turn 1: Swamp -> Dark Ritual -> Buried Alive Bladewing, Bogardan Hellkite, Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund
Turn 2: Swamp -> Reanimate Bladewing -> Bogardan Hellkite -> Reanimate Karrthus -> Attack -> Win
I love my Reanimator Deck.
